metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3010 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
ceph-deploy before 1.5.23 uses weak permissions (644) forceph/ceph.client.admin.keyring, which allows local users to obtainsensitive information by reading the file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3010` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ceph-deploy - 1.5.32-0ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ceph-deploy package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.5.32-0ubuntu1').
